metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6806 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
By carefully crafting promise resolutions, it was possible to cause anout-of-bounds read off the end of an array resized during script execution.This could have led to memory corruption and a potentially exploitablecrash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.6, Firefox < 74, Firefox< ESR68.6, and Firefox ESR < 68.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '74.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
